page.title: 06The Buildings of Amble
page.content: People have lived in the village of Amble since{mediaeval times.}The homes are clustered around the green just above the old flood level of what was until the mid 1960's a tidal tributary of the river Camel. The road bridge crossing the stream to Penpont and beyond was rebuilt in 1937. In the village centre there was an old{black {smith's forge}which has recently been turned into a craft shop. One of the {oldest cottages}in the village is the other shop in Amble, it is the{local {Post Office}and general stores. In one part of the village green is a small, low building where the villagers used to keep their pigs many years ago. Several of the houses are let to tourists all year round, although the majority are occupied by elderly or retired people.The{old houses}of Amble are really charming.
